title: Calories in a Whole Cantaloupe
meta_description: Discover calories in a whole cantaloupe, including carbs, fiber, vitamins, per-100g breakdown, and simple tweaks for your diet.
assumptions: Medium cantaloupe with approximately 500g edible flesh (rind and seeds removed); fresh, raw.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, variety, and growing conditions. Check produce labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A whole medium cantaloupe offers about 170 calories, rich in vitamin A and hydration.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Topped with 1/4 cup plain Greek yogurt
Blended into a smoothie with 1/2 banana

faqs.q: How many calories in half a whole cantaloupe?
faqs.a: About 85 calories for half (250g edible portion).
Yes, only 34 kcal per 100g, making a whole one under 200 kcal.

faqs.q: What vitamins are in a whole cantaloupe?
faqs.a: High in vitamin A (over 500% DV) and vitamin C (about 200% DV), plus potassium.

faqs.q: How much fiber in a whole cantaloupe?
faqs.a: Around 4.5g total, aiding digestion and satiety.

faqs.q: Does cantaloupe have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: About 39.5g natural sugars in a whole one, but balanced by fiber and low glycemic index.
